page.title: 08FECKENHAM WAKE
page.content: The Wake was originally held to celebrate the granting of a charter by Henry the second. It is held annually on the nearest Sunday to the 24th June. Years ago the Wake took the form of a market on the green. There is mention of a large black bear being present. At the begining of this century the Wake took the form of a fair and it moved onto a local field as the green was not large enough. There were swing boats, rounderbout horses and a coconut shy. These days the Wake is still held every year. It has now moved back to its original site on the village green. It has stalls of local produce, flowers and games. The great attraction for the children this year was a bouncy castle.
